Gonna spend the whole week there (and that means my whole vacation). I'm looking forward to seeing them all again, strangely enough :) Maybe I'll update some while I'm there, I don't know. Cuz I've known him for about 7 or 8 years and he's one of my closest friends. But enough chat for now, gotta go to bed now....I'll tell y' more 'bout it later :)

The pain.... Damn! My head feels like it has Safri Duo banging it's brain right now. It must be the weather, I'm quite sensitive that way. I can't stand moist, heavy weather. I'm constantly walking around with a headache if the weather's like that. At least if I'm inside at the time. If it's a bit windy outside I can survive without painkillers. But that means staying in the wind until the weather lightens up... But enough whining for now. I got the groove on today. I really did, and that resulted in a urlLink photogallery for yer wiewing pleasure. So now I'd like for a certian person to shut the hell up! (yes, I'm talking about u miss sarasafari ;) I dunno what it is with browsers (read: people browsing trough websites) and pictures, but it seems that it's all they wanna see. None of them cares much for the written word. Sadly the majority of browsers is that way, so y' might say I've sold out in a way. But I don't care, I was going to do this photogallery anyways. It just wasn't the first on my list. But no that I've started I'll probably keep doing it for a while, at least until I get sick'n tired of re-nameing pics and shit. The hardest part is writing something about the pics. As I look at them, memories pop up. I get flashbacks and my troath sometimes get all cluttered up. I really got a lot to write about all of them but I can't write to much either...the golden center is hard to find. At least I know this much, there's a whole bunch of folks out there I miss a great deal. And specially the folks from my year at Fredheim. I got all cluttered in my troath looking at those pictures, as a matter in fact I'm getting that way right now *sob* I also miss my folks back home, my mom'n dad, my sister, my best friends....God, I gotta stop now y'all. Never figured digging out all those pictures would get me so ...so...*sob* (and if that wasn't enough, their playing a softtune on the radio right now!) Mom, Dad, Beate, John Thomas, Ødegård, Vidar, Kris, Thomas, and all the other friends I have - I love and miss y'all a so phreakin' much!!!

Pixar have also made quite a lot of good short movies (animated they to). I'm currently looking for'em on DivX so if any of u have some of them, urlLink e-mail me will ya. T he second movie was urlLink "Sling Blade" . And all I can say is that it's Briliant! So get of yer ass and go rent'em will ya :) Now I gotta run home, my girl called and said she was sick, she said she had 38,8 degrees fever (what's the code for the degrees symbol anyways?). Poor thing...

Okay, so here I am again. Trying to give ye something to read. I've been looking at a lot of other blog sites lately and I just gotta say this; Damn! I wish I could be that good. But I'm not, so I'll just have to keep this lousy layout :( But I really hope that I someday get to realize my dream, and that is getting a webdesigner certificat! It's my one and only dream (well, actually I have others but their "in the making" so to speak ;o) and I just wish that someday I'll get it done. Imagine being payed to use yer imagination. What a blast that has to be! I'm all full of ideas, thoughts and shit I'd like to make, but I lack the skills. So they just fade away into oblivion, until next time I get triggered. And that's no fun, no fun at all... Maybe I'll give ye a few hint so y'all will get the idea: § 1: urlLink MizDos and her daily rants § 2: urlLink Wallflower.nu § 3: urlLink Bratta.com - dhtml and other things [not a blogsite] § 4: urlLink Crash.neotope.com - bringing you the best of nothing since 1999 § 5: urlLink Blogger.com [here ye can find a lot of good blogs with nice layouts] So know ye understad, maybe y'all wanna pitch in? *lol* No? Figured so :p Other than that, not much have happend lately. Still planning my wedding, getting ends to meet, planning a holliday (and it will be Bloggerised! ;o). Speaking of hollidays, it just popped into my head that I havent seen my folks in six months! Haven't seen my buddies in that long a time either. Gonna have a lot of catching up to do, oh yeah baby! It's going to be so much fun to see the freaks again, I'm jumping around just thinking about it :D And it's only two weeks from tomorrow! Yipes! Maybe it's time to fix me some airline tickets? U would think so right? *lol* Now I'm all out of shit to write. But hey, this has to my longest one yet. And it even makes sense *lol* I'm gonna go now, but y'all come back now y' hear :)

Question; I signed up with urlLink Sitemeter.com yesterday, and fixed the counter so it would show my previous visiters to. Yipes! Although the blogathon didn't go as expected (my ISP went down...again!), it wasn't a total loss. I've had my all-time-high in visitors cuz of the 'thon ring :) In one day (29 Jul, Sun, 2001) I got 135 unique visitors, that's more than I've ever had. Which then proves how poor my site really is :\ And I got an site rewiew from jessica at urlLink jess.pika-grrl.net Weheeee! I'm happy :) Site Owner : Jigsaw Site URL : http://dacrib.rexta.net First Impression : 18/20 Layout : 18/20 Graphics : 20/20 Content : 10/20 Last Impression : 18/20 Total Score : 84/100 Comments : I really like Jig's splash page. The only thing a little weird is when you look at it in 800 res, but other than that it's really nice. The layout is good. Staying with the times and what's popular, but putting your own bit of style into it as well. The links on the top to the rest of the site, the mouse overs... I'm not sure if the colors can be changed or not, but if they can I think they should be changed to be with the layout colors. And I don't think they need to be with every link on the site. For the graphics that are on the site, I think they're really nice. Not over powering. There's not really a lot of content, it's mainly just a journal, pictures, and links, but the journal is interesting, which is a very good thing. Overall, it's a good site for reading. The Final Words : Decent work. What It Means : First Impression : When your site first loads, so I hafta wait for 10 graphics to load or does it all just pop up on the screen. By just scrolling on the first page is it phsyically appealing to my eyes enough that it makes me want to read more things on the site. or does it make me just want to leave before I waste my time. Does it look good on both 800 and 1024 resolution? Layout : Does your layout suit your content? Meaning do you have 20 links on your first page that could be condensed down into catagories because the linked site is small in content? Or do you have a condensed link format, but your contact infomation only has your email address. Graphics : How long to they take to load? Do they look like you found them on lycos's multimedia search and just slapped them up on your site? Or did you spend time formatting them to go with your layout. Content : Is your content about you or is it about the sites you visit and just has a journal? Would I be able to IM you and tell you I'm sorry for the crappy day you had? Last Impression : Do I want to bookmark your site to come back again? Or link you? Do I feel like signing your guestbook or writing you an email to tell you how I feel about your site? And she also said something I completly agree on! "PLEASE tag the tagboard or the guestbook or SOMETHING to let me know you've been here, alright? People have gotten out of the habit of signing guestbooks and I think it's a habit that we need to get back into...." It's a good habit, and it's much needed. In case you didn't know it, we webmasters are folks dying for attension (or maybe it's just me?). Oh yeah, almost forgot. My good buddy urlLink Digiboy has jumped on the bandwagon and started his own blog. urlLink Go get some!

Salut to y'all! Well, this is my first update since...well....it's been a looong time. I'm kinda sick'n tired of my web these days. Trying to find something useful to do with it. Maybe a total makeover would do the trick? But enough about this html talk now. I've been reading my old stuff and find that most of my chit-chat is pretty shallow. It hasn't become what I wanted it to be. I wanted to write a diary, not a weblog full of mostly BS. But I feel that I can't write a diary in the true sense of the word. That may offend, hurt or annoy some folks. Besides, I can understand that some folks (my girl for example) don't want their personal lifes on display. And that is what would happend if I started to write a true diary. So...what to do? Well, when and if I should begin a true diary I would have to do it somewhere else, maybe purcase a domain and don't tell anyone, or make it a hidden diary (but then what's the point of having it on the web?), or plainly write it on my own computer for my eyes only. But I've never been the diarywriting kind before, so it's hard to try to be one now. I have a problem when it comes to writing down my thoughts, my deep thoughts that is. I can write on and on about a certan topic, but when it comes to writing my thoughts, or sum up a whole day.....I'm at a total loss. So what I'm gonna do is continue this weblog full of BS, but I'm gonna try to make the BS have a topic, or rather talk BS with a meaning :) I'm full of BS so this is a good way of emptying the BS-tank so to speak. And I hope I can make it entertaining for you as well. So from now on it will be less updates (I think ;), but the updates will have some sort of contence....or try to at least. I'm not promising anything :) And that ends the story for today kids, but before I go I'd like to ask you all one favor. I've found out that getting rezpons from my visitors is hard (getting visitor is even harder!). The respond link at the end of all my posts have NEVER been used (thus I removed it), the urlLink guestbook is in use maybe once every millenium, and not one person have ever answerd any of my questions in this weblog! Therefor I ask of you this, just send me a blank urlLink e-mail . You don't have to write ANYTHING, just urlLink mail me! .....and if you can get me more visitors by linking me or whatever, feel free to do so ;)

Okay, why is it that every time I'm at work I get the cravings for a smoke?! I quit smoking almost six months ago but when I'm at work I tend to have a smoke or two (or three...). I really wanna quit all together! When I'm at home I never get these cravings, well, almost never. If my buddy Digiboy's there, or any other smoker, I get them. If I'm not around smokers I have no problem what so ever, but as soo as I get around them I feel a little craving comming on. I tend to smoke when I'm out having a good time at the pub or other places. But nothing makes me wanna smoke more then when I'm at work. Maybe it's because all my co-workers smoke. I dunno, but at least I don't go around craving them all the time. But alas, I really want to quit all together. With the exeption of when I'm partying if course ;) Thank God my girlfriend shares that opinion (don't get that one wrong, okay?). If I couldn't smoke when I'm drinking I would go insane....hehe But I have to admidt that when it's sunny and warm outside, and I'm walking downtown I really miss that little smoke....why is all the good things in life bad for you?! Not to mention expensive! Oh well, as long as I don't start all over I probably should be happy. But I'm walking the thin red line.......and I'm damn good at it :)

WARNING: big-ass post below, proceed with eyes wide open! It's been a long time now, so this is gonna be a big-ass update! Are you up for it? Sure? Okay, let's go! The wedding... As you might have seen the last post I had was three days before the wedding. And then I went all silent on you. Well, it was much to do those last three days. We had to get all the last things together. We had to decorate the house we had rented. We had to decorate the church, We had to practise and schtuff...etc, etc. But finaly the day was there, and boy was I nervous!! urlLink The curch was perfect. The weather was more than perfect! The wedding started at 13:00 (one o'clock) on Saturday. As the musicman started playing the weddingmarch I couldn't stop smiling. Because there came urlLink the most beautiful bride I had EVER seen! I had to remind my self to breath more than once. She was so beautiful that the first thing I said to my best man when she entered the curch was; "Oh my God, she's so beautiful!!" I didn't even know I said it untill he told me after the wedding. But I think God will forgive me, don't you?...hehe. The priest was an unusualy cool priest, so the wedding went smooth and was kinda amusing at times :) Then we drove of for the photosession. In a '58 Buick! Damn, that car was fly! . Oh, here's a picture of urlLink us kneeling for the blessing . Almost forgott to add that one. After the photosession (you'll get to see those pictures later, when I get the time to scan'em...) we went to the house we rented for dinner and coffee. And a whole urlLink lotsa urlLink cake! And a huge wedding cake, made by BM 2 's sister. Here are some pictures of that: urlLink 1 , urlLink 2 , urlLink 3 , urlLink 4 , urlLink 5 , urlLink 6 . And the party went on for hours, long into the night. We had many fun games, i.e a urlLink question game where we had to answer on who did what in our relationship...very funny. Not to many answers where alike though...hehe. And a urlLink weird play where the people playing had to have urlLink matches in their mouths. So their lines where urlLink quite amusing , even for the urlLink players ! And we even had a urlLink musical act :^) Then, after many hours of fun and talking, smiling, being taken pictures of...etc...etc, we went to the hotell for our wedding night *wink wink*. But enough of that, here are some more pictures from the party that night: urlLink my aunt and her twins singing a song for us urlLink my buddies (from the right; my best man Tor Atle, John Thomas and Vidar) urlLink my wife and her bridesgirl urlLink my mom and dad enjoying the cake urlLink the new family urlLink me and my wife and urlLink me and my wife again Now that's about all there is to say about out wedding day at the moment. There's more to come later one so don't panic ;^) After we got home... ...I started my new job, quite fun I must say. And we went on a small vacation this weekend. Now that was a great thing to do. We really needed that time off after all this planning and shit. And we had a great time. just the two of us...all alone...in a cabin with a sauna and other nice things ;^) So, did you make it this far? Wow! You're a great reader/fan/friend then :^) Sorry about the size of the pictures, but I didn't wanna spoil the great quality to much. So now you know why I've been so quiet these past weeks. But spread the word, da man is back!! With backup! (BM 2 ) And thanks for all the mails (no, correction, the one mail) I got. And the nice greatings in various sites all around. Oh yes, urlLink Molly over at urlLink the stand said something good while trying to get me to buy an urlLink umbrella (like i don't have enough, living in Bergen...it's Norways answer to London x 10!). She said, and I quote, "Here's a tip: never show your blog to people you might wanna blog about later." Now that's a good tip. I my self have three rules about having a diary/weblog/blog/log/thingamajig. 1: Dont tell the whole world where your site is, might be a good idea to exlude family as well (annoying as they can be). Trust me. There will be a time when you want to really say something about someone! If you are a sucker for compliments about you abnormaly cool site (like me and mine;-) get readers! 2: Do NOT give up your url in your resyme! You're job takes up 70-80% of your time. If you can't blog about that, then what's left? Not much I tell you. I've had that problem for quite some time now. Untill I found out (today) that I didn't put my current url on the resyme *evil grin and satanic laughter*. Now that whas a relief! 3: These are the golden and unwritten (untill now) rules. These should not be broken. If you already have broken one or two of them. Then follow this third rule. MOVE!! Change url as fast as you can dammit! Save your freedom of speach as fast as you can. And that ends our brodcast of the day. Good night, and don't lett the bedbugs bite.
